title: Game Theory and Strategic Interaction
description: Application of Active Inference to game theory, strategic decision making, and multi-agent interactions.
learning_objectives: Model strategic games using Active Inference
Understand equilibrium concepts from Active Inference perspective

content.overview: Game theory studies strategic interaction between rational agents. Active Inference provides a framework for modeling how agents learn, adapt, and coordinate in game-theoretic settings through belief updating and expected free energy minimization.

normal_form_games.payoff_matrix: A_ij = payoff for player i when players choose actions j
normal_form_games.nash_equilibrium: No player can improve payoff by unilateral deviation
normal_form_games.active_inference: Agents choose actions to minimize expected free energy
normal_form_games.beliefs_about_others: Players form beliefs about opponents' strategies

extensive_form_games.game_tree: Sequential decision making with perfect information
extensive_form_games.backward_induction: Solving games by working backwards from end
extensive_form_games.active_inference_planning: Multi-step planning with expected free energy

learning_in_games.fictitious_play: Players believe opponents play stationary mixed strategies
learning_in_games.active_inference_learning: Learn opponents' strategies through belief updating

cooperative_games.coalition_formation: Players form groups to improve outcomes

examples.name: Prisoner's Dilemma
examples.active_inference: Cooperation when epistemic benefits outweigh defection gains

examples.name: Coordination Games
examples.active_inference: Convergence to focal points through belief alignment

examples.name: Market Entry Game
examples.description: Deciding whether to enter competitive market
examples.setup: Two players decide simultaneously to enter or stay out
examples.active_inference: Players form beliefs about opponent's entry probability

evolutionary_game_theory.replicator_dynamics: dx_i/dt = x_i (π_i - π̄) where π_i is payoff for strategy i
evolutionary_game_theory.evolutionarily_stable_strategy: Strategy that cannot be invaded by mutants

mechanism_design.incentive_compatibility: Agents' interests aligned with mechanism goals
mechanism_design.active_inference_design: Design mechanisms that minimize collective free energy

interactive_exercises.description: Simulate game with Active Inference players
interactive_exercises.games: Prisoner's dilemma, coordination games, market entry
interactive_exercises.task: Observe equilibrium emergence and learning dynamics

interactive_exercises.description: Design mechanism using Active Inference principles
interactive_exercises.objective: Achieve desired outcomes with strategic agents

common_misconceptions.clarification: Active Inference provides models of bounded rationality
Active Inference shows cooperation can emerge from self-interest

further_reading.title: Active Inference in Games
further_reading.author: Community literature
further_reading.description: Applications of Active Inference to game theory

interactive_exercises.title: Analyze Game Theory and Strategic Interaction Application
interactive_exercises.scenario: A company is trying to apply Game Theory and Strategic Interaction to solve a complex problem in their domain.
questions: What are the key challenges in this application?
How does the Active Inference approach help?
What are the potential benefits and drawbacks?
What metrics would you use to evaluate success?

interactive_exercises.title: Design Game Theory and Strategic Interaction System
requirements: Should provide clear interfaces and documentation

interactive_exercises.title: Plan Game Theory and Strategic Interaction Implementation
Discuss: Game Theory and Strategic Interaction
questions: How does game theory and strategic interaction relate to other Active Inference concepts?
What are the practical implications of game theory and strategic interaction?
What challenges arise when applying game theory and strategic interaction?
How might game theory and strategic interaction evolve in the future?

interactive_exercises.title: Research: Game Theory and Strategic Interaction Applications
questions: Find a real-world application of game theory and strategic interaction
What research papers discuss game theory and strategic interaction?
How is game theory and strategic interaction used in industry?
What are current research challenges related to game theory and strategic interaction?

How does this compare to alternative approaches?
